statements: SELECT file_name, file_size FROM Files;
SELECT file_name, file_size FROM Files WHERE file_size > 1000;
SELECT * FROM Files ORDER BY file_name ASC;
SELECT file_name, file_size FROM Files WHERE file_size < 5000 ORDER BY file_size DESC;
SELECT file_name, file_size, keywords FROM Files;
SELECT file_name, file_size FROM Files WHERE file_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM Files WHERE file_size > 1000 ORDER BY file_name ASC;
SELECT file_name, COUNT(file_id) AS total_files FROM Files GROUP BY file_name;
SELECT file_name, file_size FROM Files WHERE file_name LIKE '%example%' AND file_size BETWEEN 500 AND 1000;
SELECT * FROM Files ORDER BY file_id DESC LIMIT 3;
SELECT * FROM file_search_files;
SELECT file_name, file_path FROM file_search_files WHERE file_id = 1;
SELECT file_id, file_name, file_path FROM file_search_files ORDER BY file_name ASC;
SELECT file_id, file_name, file_path FROM file_search_files WHERE file_name LIKE 'report%';
SELECT file_id, file_name, file_path FROM file_search_files WHERE file_keywords IS NOT NULL;
SELECT file_id, file_name, file_path, file_keywords FROM file_search_files WHERE file_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM file_search_files WHERE file_name LIKE '%report%' OR file_keywords LIKE '%analysis%';
SELECT file_name, file_path FROM file_search_files WHERE file_path IS NOT NULL ORDER BY file_name ASC;
SELECT file_id, file_name FROM file_search_files JOIN file_search_keywords ON file_keywords LIKE CONCAT('%', keyword_name, '%') ORDER BY file_id DESC;
SELECT COUNT(file_id) AS total_files, COUNT(DISTINCT file_keywords) AS total_keywords FROM file_search_files;
SELECT * FROM files;
SELECT file_name, file_path FROM files WHERE keywords @> ARRAY['important'];
SELECT file_name, file_path, keywords FROM files ORDER BY file_name DESC;
SELECT * FROM keywords WHERE keyword = 'database';
SELECT files.file_name, keywords.keyword FROM files JOIN file_keywords ON files.file_id = file_keywords.file_id JOIN keywords ON file_keywords.keyword_id = keywords.keyword_id;
SELECT file_id, file_name, file_path FROM files WHERE file_name LIKE '%example%' ORDER BY file_name ASC;
SELECT file_id, file_name, file_path FROM files WHERE file_id = '1a2b3c4d-5e6f-7g8h-9i10j11k12l' OR file_name LIKE '%report%' ORDER BY file_name DESC;
SELECT file_id, file_name, file_path FROM files WHERE file_id <> '1a2b3c4d-5e6f-7g8h-9i10j11k12l' AND file_name ILIKE 'document %' ORDER BY file_name ASC, file_id DESC;

SELECT f.file_id, f.file_name, f.file_path, k.keyword FROM files f JOIN file_keywords fk ON f.file_id = fk.file_id JOIN keywords k ON fk.keyword_id = k.keyword_id WHERE k.keyword = 'important' ORDER BY f.file_name ASC, f.file_path DESC;
SELECT f.file_id, f.file_name, f.file_path, array_to_string(f.keywords, ', ') AS file_keywords FROM files f WHERE cardinality(f.keywords) > 3 ORDER BY f.file_name DESC, f.file_id ASC;
SELECT * FROM FileMetadata;
SELECT file_name, file_path FROM FileMetadata WHERE keywords LIKE '%important%';
SELECT file_name, keywords FROM FileMetadata ORDER BY file_name DESC;
SELECT DISTINCT tag_name FROM FileTags;
SELECT file_name, tag_name FROM FileMetadata JOIN FileTagMappings ON FileMetadata.file_id = FileTagMappings.file_id JOIN FileTags ON FileTagMappings.tag_id = FileTags.tag_id;
SELECT * FROM FileMetadata ORDER BY file_name DESC, file_id ASC;
SELECT file_name, file_path FROM FileMetadata WHERE keywords LIKE '%important%';
SELECT fm.file_id, ft.tag_name FROM FileMetadata fm JOIN FileTagMappings ftm ON fm.file_id = ftm.file_id JOIN FileTags ft ON ftm.tag_id = ft.tag_id WHERE ft.tag_name = 'important';
SELECT search_keyword, search_timestamp FROM FileSearchHistory WHERE search_timestamp BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-01-31';
SELECT ft.tag_name, COUNT(ftm.file_id) AS file_count FROM FileTagMappings ftm JOIN FileTags ft ON ftm.tag_id = ft.tag_id GROUP BY ft.tag_name HAVING file_count > 1;
SELECT file_name, file_path FROM files;
SELECT file_id, file_name, file_path, file_content FROM files WHERE file_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM file_keywords WHERE keyword_id = 1;
SELECT tag_name, file_id FROM file_tags ORDER BY tag_name ASC;
SELECT file_id, file_size, created_at FROM file_metadata WHERE file_size > 1000;
SELECT * FROM files
SELECT file_id, file_name FROM files
SELECT DISTINCT file_path FROM files
SELECT file_name, file_path, file_content FROM files
SELECT f.file_name, fk.keyword_id, k.keyword_text FROM files f JOIN file_keywords fk ON f.file_id = fk.file_id JOIN keywords k ON fk.keyword_id = k.keyword_id
